p: Sixty-four male Wistar rats (weighing: 200–220 g) were obtained from the Laboratory Animal Facility of the School of Veterinary Medicine, Razi University, Kermanshah, Iran. The animals were randomly divided into 8 groups (8 in each group). Rats were maintained under standard laboratory conditions according to European Guidelines for Environmental Control in Laboratory Animal Facilities (ambient temperature of 22±1°C, 12:12 h light-dark cycle).
